According to its articles of association , it is a non - profit - making organisation , its general aim being to promote creativity , communication and entertainment through the audiovisual media . Its activities include operating a cinema called " Cinematograph " in GPE .

The first of these showings was scheduled for CARDINAL DATE . All were to take place at TIME except for CARDINAL matinée performance on DATE at TIME
This announcement was made in an information bulletin distributed by ORG to its CARDINAL members and in various display windows in GPE including that of the FAC itself . It was worded as follows :

" PERSON satirical tragedy set in Heaven was filmed by PERSON from a performance by ORG in GPE and set in the context of a reconstruction of the writer ’s trial and conviction in DATE for blasphemy . PERSON starts from the assumption that syphilis was God ’s punishment for man ’s fornication and sinfulness at the time of the ORG , especially at the court of the PERSON Pope PERSON . CARDINAL . ORG At the request of the FAC diocese of ORG , the public prosecutor instituted criminal proceedings against ORG ’s manager , Mr PERSON , on DATE . The charge was " disparaging religious doctrines " ( Herabwürdigung religiöser Lehren ) , an act prohibited by LAW .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , after the film had been shown at a private session in the presence of a duty judge ( GPE ) , the public prosecutor made an application for its seizure under section CARDINAL of LAW ( Mediengesetz - see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . This application was granted by ORG ( PERSON ) DATE . As a result , the public showings announced by ORG , the first of which had been scheduled for DATE , could not take place .

CARDINAL . ORG An appeal by PERSON against the seizure order , filed with ORG ( ORG ) , was dismissed on DATE . ORG considered that artistic freedom was necessarily limited by the rights of others to freedom of religion and by the duty of the ORG to safeguard a society based on order and tolerance . It further held that indignation was " justified " for the purposes of section CARDINAL of LAW only if its object was such as to offend the religious feelings of an average person with normal religious sensitivity . That condition was fulfilled in the instant case and forfeiture of the film could be ordered in principle , at least in " objective proceedings " ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The wholesale derision of religious feeling outweighed any interest the general public might have in information or the financial interests of persons wishing to show the film .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the criminal prosecution against PERSON was discontinued and the case was pursued in the form of " objective proceedings " under LAW para . CARDINAL of LAW aimed at suppression of the film .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE a trial took place before ORG . The film was again shown in closed session ; its contents were described in detail in the official record of the hearing .

Mr PERSON appears in the official record of the hearing as a witness . He stated that he had sent the film back to the distributor following the seizure order because he wanted nothing more to do with the matter .
It appears from the judgment - which was delivered the same day - that Mr PERSON was considered to be a " potentially liable interested party " ( PERSON ) .
ORG found it to be established that the distributor of the film had waived its right to be heard and had agreed to the destruction of its copy of the film .
CARDINAL . ORG In its judgment ORG ordered the forfeiture of the film . It held :

" The public projection scheduled for CARDINAL DATE of the film PERSON , in which God the Father is presented both in image and in text as a senile , impotent idiot , PERSON as a cretin and PERSON of God as a wanton lady with a corresponding manner of expression and in which the ORG is ridiculed , came within the definition of the criminal offence of disparaging religious precepts as laid down in section CARDINAL of LAW . "
The court ’s reasoning included the following :

" The conditions of section CARDINAL of LAW are objectively fulfilled by this portrayal of the divine persons - God the Father , PERSON of God and PERSON are the central figures in NORP religious doctrine and practice , being of the most essential importance , also for the religious understanding of the believers - as well as by the above - mentioned expressions concerning the Eucharist , which is one of the most important mysteries of the NORP religion , the more so in view of the general character of the film as an attack on NORP religions ...

... Article PERSON of LAW Staatsgrundgesetz ) guarantees the freedom of artistic creation and the publication and teaching of article The scope of artistic freedom was broadened ( by the introduction of that article ) to the extent that every form of artistic expression is protected and limitations of artistic freedom are no longer possible by way of an express legal provision but may only follow from the limitations inherent in this freedom ... . Artistic freedom can not be unlimited . The limitations on artistic freedom are to be found , firstly , in other basic rights and freedoms guaranteed by LAW ( such as the freedom of religion and conscience ) , secondly , in the need for an ordered form of human coexistence based on tolerance , and finally in flagrant and extreme violations of other interests protected by law ( GPE anderer rechtlich geschützter GPE ) , the specific circumstances having to be weighed up against each other in each case , taking due account of all relevant considerations ...

The fact that the conditions of section CARDINAL of LAW are fulfilled does not automatically mean that the limit of the artistic freedom guaranteed by LAW has been reached . However , in view of the above considerations and the particular gravity in the instant case - which concerned a film primarily intended to be provocative and aimed at ORG multiple and sustained violation of legally protected interests , the basic right of artistic freedom will in the instant case have to come second .

CARDINAL . ORG The play on which the film is based was written by PERSON and published in DATE . In DATE PERSON was found guilty by ORG ( ORG ) of " crimes against religion " and sentenced to a term of imprisonment . The play was banned in GPE although it continued in print elsewhere .

CARDINAL . ORG The play portrays God the Father as old , infirm and ineffective , PERSON as a " mummy ’s boy " of low intelligence and PERSON , who is obviously in charge , as an unprincipled wanton . Together they decide that mankind must be punished for its immorality . They reject the possibility of outright destruction in favour of a form of punishment which will leave it both " in need of salvation " and " capable of redemption " . Being unable to think of such a punishment by themselves , they decide to call on the PERSON for help .

The PERSON suggests the idea of a sexually transmitted affliction , so that men and women will infect one another without realising it ; he procreates with ORG to produce a daughter who will spread it among mankind . The symptoms as described by the PERSON are those of syphilis .

As his reward , the PERSON claims freedom of thought ; PERSON says that she will " think about it " . The PERSON then dispatches his daughter to do her work , first among those who represent worldly power , then to the court of the Pope , to the bishops , to the convents and monasteries and finally to the common people .

CARDINAL . ORG The film , directed by PERSON , was released in DATE . It begins and ends with scenes purporting to be taken from the trial of PERSON in DATE . In between , it shows a performance of the play by the Teatro Belli in GPE . The film portrays the God of the NORP religion , the NORP religion and the NORP religion as an apparently senile old man prostrating himself before the PERSON with whom he exchanges a deep kiss and calling the PERSON his friend . He is also portrayed as swearing by the PERSON . Other scenes show PERSON permitting an obscene story to be read to her and the manifestation of a degree of erotic tension between PERSON and the PERSON . The adult PERSON is portrayed as a low grade mental defective and in one scene is shown lasciviously attempting to fondle and kiss his mother ’s breasts , which she is shown as permitting . God , PERSON and GPE are shown in the film applauding the PERSON .

( CARDINAL ) Enjoyment of civil and political rights shall be independent of religious confessions ; however , a religious confession may not stand in the way of civic duties .

( CARDINAL ) No one shall be compelled to take any church - related action or to participate in any church - related celebration , except in pursuance of a power conferred by law on another person to whose authority he is subject . "
CARDINAL . ORG Artistic freedom is guaranteed by LAW , which provides :
" There shall be freedom of artistic creation and of the publication and teaching of article "
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Penal Code reads as follows :

" Whoever , in circumstances where his behaviour is likely to arouse justified indignation , disparages or insults a person who , or an object which , is an object of veneration of a church or religious community established within the country , or a dogma , a lawful custom or a lawful institution of such a church or religious community , shall be liable to a prison sentence of DATE or a fine of CARDINAL DATE rates . "

CARDINAL . ORG A media offence ( ORG ) is defined as " [ a]n act entailing liability to a judicial penalty , committed through the content of a publication medium , consisting in a communication or performance aimed at a relatively large number of persons " ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of LAW ) . Criminal liability for such offences is determined according to the general penal law , in so far as it is not derogated from or added to by special provisions of LAW ( section CARDINAL of LAW ) .

CARDINAL . ORG A specific sanction provided for by LAW is forfeiture ( GPE ) of the publication concerned ( section CARDINAL ) . Forfeiture may be ordered in addition to any normal sanction under LAW ( section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ) .

If prosecution or conviction of any person for a criminal offence is not possible , forfeiture can also be ordered in separate so - called " objective " proceedings for the suppression of a publication , as provided for under LAW para . CARDINAL of LAW , by virtue of which :

" Forfeiture shall be ordered in separate proceedings at the request of the public prosecutor if a publication in the media satisfies the objective definition of a criminal offence and if the prosecution of a particular person can not be secured or if conviction of such person is impossible on grounds precluding punishment ... "
CARDINAL . ORG The seizure ( Beschlagnahme ) of a publication pending the decision on forfeiture may be effected pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW , which reads :

" CARDINAL . The court may order the seizure of the copies intended for distribution to the public of a work published through the media if it can be assumed that forfeiture will be ordered under section CARDINAL and if the adverse consequences of such seizure are not disproportionate to the legitimate interests served thereby . Seizure may not be effected in any case if such legitimate interests can also be served by publication of a notice concerning the criminal proceedings instituted .

CARDINAL . Seizure presupposes the prior or simultaneous institution of criminal proceedings or objective proceedings concerning a media offence and an express application to that effect by the public prosecutor or the complainant in separate proceedings .
CARDINAL . The decision ordering seizure shall mention the passage or part of the published work and the suspected offence having prompted the seizure ...
CARDINAL - CARDINAL . ... "

CARDINAL . ORG The general law of criminal procedure applies to the prosecution of media offences and to objective proceedings . Although in objective proceedings the owner or publisher of the published work does not stand accused of any criminal offence , he is treated as a full party , by virtue of section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL , which reads :

" [ In criminal proceedings or objective proceedings concerning a media offence ] the media owner ( publisher ) shall be summoned to the hearing . He shall have the rights of the accused ; in particular , he shall be entitled to the same defences as the accused and to appeal against the judgment on the merits ... "
